Package net.peierls.puzzle

A framework for describing and solving puzzles that involve moves from an initial state to a solution state.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    PuzzleSolver<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    Interface for algorithms that search for solutions to a puzzles of the parameterized type.
    PuzzleState<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    A state that a puzzle of parameterized type T can be in.
    PuzzleStateFilter<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    A container for states that offers only an approximate containment test, no removal, and no iteration, modeled on the idea of a Bloom filter and mimicking the Guava BloomFilter interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractPuzzleSolver<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    Abstract base for puzzle solvers that use a PuzzleStateFilter to keep track (possibility only approximately) of which states have been seen during the search for a solution.
    BfsPuzzleSolver<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    Breadth-first-search puzzle solver.
    BloomPuzzleStateFilter<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    An implementation of PuzzleStateFilter with approximate containment that uses a BloomFilter internally.
    DfsPuzzleSolver<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    Depth-first-search puzzle solver.
    ExactPuzzleStateFilter<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    An implementation of PuzzleStateFilter with exact containment: ExactPuzzleStateFilter.mightContain(T) returns true iff the given state has been added; the return value of ExactPuzzleStateFilter.put(T) reflects whether the state was added for the first time; ExactPuzzleStateFilter.expectedFalsePositiveProbability() always returns 0.0; and ExactPuzzleStateFilter.approximateElementCount() is always true number of distinct elements added.

Package net.peierls.puzzle Description

A framework for describing and solving puzzles that involve moves from an initial state to a solution state.
